meanings.definition: To make or become thicker or more dense.
meanings.sent1: I use flour to thicken the soup.
meanings.sent2: The sauce will thicken as it simmers on the stove.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally thicken the gravy too much, and now it's like pudding!
meanings.sent4: Her accent seemed to thicken as she spoke about her hometown.
meanings.sent5: The fog began to thicken, making it hard to see more than a few feet ahead.

meanings.definition: To make or become more substantial or strong.
meanings.sent1: Adding more support will thicken the walls of the building.
meanings.sent2: The plot of the story will thicken as the mystery unfolds.
meanings.sent3: His excuses for being late always seem to thicken when he's in trouble.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room seemed to thicken with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The bond between them continued to thicken, growing stronger with each shared experience.
